translation.en: [man in French] I think the word captain is…
translation.es: Creo que la palabra capitán es…

translation.en: Is above all a feeling of pride.
[man in Portuguese] You give that responsibility only to people you trust.
translation.es: Le das esa responsabilidadsolo a la gente en la que confías.

translation.en: [man in Croatian] You need to be your manager's right hand.
translation.es: Debes ser la mano derecha del técnico.

translation.en: [man in Arabic] A good player does not always make a good leader or captain.
translation.es: Un buen jugador no siemprees un buen líder o capitán.

translation.en: [man 1 in English] It's the best thing that can happen to anyone.
translation.es: Es lo mejor que te puede pasar.

translation.en: [man 2] Wearing the captain band,
translation.es: Como capitán, no puedes mostrar miedo.

translation.en: you can't show fear. You can't show nerves.
translation.es: Como capitán, no puedes mostrar miedo. Ni nervios.

translation.en: Silencing them is gonna feel good, eh?
I work hard for you. You work hard for me.
[Blake] We wanna go to the World Cup.
[Maatouk in Arabic] Everyone's counting on us.
[Modrić in Croatian] It will be emotional and difficult.
[Aubameyang in French] It's a whole country behind you.
-[in Jamaican Patois] Think I like losing? -[in Croatian] Clear it.
[Silva in Portuguese] I am getting goosebumps.
translation.es: Se me pone la piel de gallina.

translation.en: We're going to Qatar!
[Modrić in Croatian] I don't like to talk about myself as if I'm bragging,
translation.es: No me gusta hablar de mícomo si presumiera…

translation.en: but I always had the feeling I was a leader.
translation.es: pero siempre sentí que era un líder.

translation.en: [man 1 in French] Good evening, everyone.
After a busy night of African qualifiers for the World Cup 2022 in Qatar…
translation.es: Tras una noche de eliminatorias africanaspara la Copa del Mundo 2022 en Catar…

translation.en: …we're back focusing on the Panthers of Gabon
translation.es: volvemos a concentrarnosen las Panteras de Gabón,

translation.en: whose campaign has just gotten underway against Libya.
translation.es: cuya campaña contra Libiaacaba de comenzar.

translation.en: Gabon scored first.
[man 2] It's a nice combination from Gabon.
translation.es: Es una buena combinación de Gabón.

translation.en: And it's in off the post.
translation.es: Rebota en el poste y es gol.

translation.en: The Gabonese defense was all over the place.
translation.es: La defensa de Gabón estaba dispersa.

translation.en: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang with the strike!
Just a few seconds left in this game.
A cross into the box. The header!
And it's Libya in the final minute
that take the lead.
Gabon crack at the end of the game.
translation.es: Gabón colapsa al final del partido.

translation.en: [reporter] It was a big upset. Libya gaining a shock win.
translation.es: Fue una gran sorpresa que Libia ganara.

translation.en: [Aubameyang] I was pissed off.
We were all disappointed.
It's our fault.
It's not even the opponent. It's us.
translation.es: No es el rival, somos nosotros.

translation.en: I don't want to miss out.
[reporter] Will Aubameyang ever get the chance to play at a World Cup?
translation.es: ¿Aubameyang podrá jugaren una Copa del Mundo?

translation.en: For sure he belongs on that stage, but do Gabon?
translation.es: Él debería estar ahí… CENTRO DE ENTRENAMIENTO DE GABÓN …pero ¿Gabón?

translation.en: [Aubameyang] I was born in France, but I grew up like an African.
translation.es: Nací en Francia,pero crecí como africano.

translation.en: People ask me the question, "Why?"
translation.es: La gente me pregunta por qué.

translation.en: "Why did you choose Gabon?"
My father.
The first memory in my head,
I was very small.
My father was playing.
He scored a goal.
[commentator] Oh, the goal of Aubame!
Wow. It was incredible how many people were cheering.
translation.es: Fue increíble cuánta gente lo aplaudió.

translation.en: I was thinking, "What's going on?"
It was a very powerful moment.
We scored some goals tonight, which felt good for the team.
translation.es: Anotamos hoy,y eso fue bueno para el equipo.

translation.en: The most important thing is winning.
I think from that point on,
translation.es: Creo que, a partir de ese momento,

translation.en: he was my role model.
translation.es: él fue mi ejemplo a seguir.

translation.en: [man] I like fashion, so does Pierre-Emerick.
translation.es: Me gusta la moda, como a Pierre-Emerick.

translation.en: In the evening, when you put on something like this.
translation.es: A la noche,cuando te pones algo como esto…

translation.en: Something like this. Whoo!
When he sees this, Pierre-Emerick, he'll want to steal it from me.
Well, no stealing.
It's for me. [laughs]
I realized he had something when he was about five years old.
translation.es: Me di cuenta de que era buenocuando tenía cinco años.

translation.en: We started playing football, and I had the ball.
translation.es: Empezamos a jugar al fútboly yo tenía el balón.

translation.en: Very quickly, he takes the ball, accelerates, and shoots.
translation.es: Él tomó el balón rápido, corrió y pateó.

translation.en: I said, "Wow. He has something."
As I'd already been a professional footballer,
translation.es: Como ya había sido futbolista profesional,

translation.en: I had seen a lot of physical duels.
[commentator 1] Aubame.
[laughs] Playing with my father…
[commentator 2] Look at Aubame. Looking a little like Michael Jackson.
translation.es: Miren a Aubame.Se parece un poco a Michael Jackson.

translation.en: …it was hard.
We did a lot of one-on-ones.
There were no fouls, so it was very physical. [laughs]
translation.es: No había faltas, así que era muy físico.

translation.en: [man] His father educated him according to the morals of a patrilineal society
translation.es: Su padre lo educó según las enseñanzas de una sociedad patrilineal,porque pertenece a la tribu Fang.

translation.en: because he belongs to the Fang tribe.
translation.es: de una sociedad patrilineal,porque pertenece a la tribu Fang.

translation.en: It is a society where the concept of the father is very strong
translation.es: Es una sociedaddonde el concepto de padre es muy fuerte,

translation.en: with extremely rigorous values.
Maybe it was those values, those cultural elements,
translation.es: Tal vez sean esos valores,esos elementos culturales,

translation.en: that led him to make the choices he made.
translation.es: los que lo llevarona tomar las decisiones que tomó.

translation.en: -He'd fall, but we kept playing. -"Never complain."
translation.es: - Se caía, pero seguíamos jugando.- "Nunca te quejes".

translation.en: [Pierre-François] You couldn't say, "That's wrong."
If you say that, I get mad.
"Never complain. Get back up and continue."
It was an African education.
The hard way,
but in France.
So…
-You see what you did? So good. -[laughing]
So, so good.
[Aubameyang] My dad was very hard on me,
translation.es: Mi papá fue muy duro conmigo,

translation.en: but that's what makes me strong today.
translation.es: pero eso es lo que me hace fuerte hoy.

translation.en: [Pierre-François] When I watched him play,
I could only go now and again, and I would turn up by surprise.
translation.es: Solo podía ir de vez en cuando,de sorpresa.

translation.en: I never celebrated his goals.
When he did score, he would look to me, and I'd just stay like this.
translation.es: Cuando anotaba, me mirabay yo me quedaba así…

translation.en: All the parents are screaming, and I was like this.
translation.es: Todos los padres gritaban,y yo estaba así…

translation.en: The FA Cup final.
translation.es: La final de la FA Cup.

translation.en: That's the captain's armband that he wore when he won the FA Cup.
translation.es: Es el brazalete de capitánque usó cuando ganó la FA Cup.

translation.en: And this is the shirt that won that.
translation.es: Y esta es la camiseta que usó.

translation.en: So here we have,
"This is for you."
Also for me, and here,
"I love you."
How can you not be proud?
[Tonda] He could have been a world champion with the French team,
translation.es: Pudo haber sido campeón mundialcon el equipo francés,

translation.en: but his father is Gabonese.
It was such an inspiration for me to follow in his footsteps.
translation.es: Fue una gran inspiración para míseguir sus pasos.

translation.en: Whether it is in life or on the pitch.
translation.es: Ya sea en la vida o en la cancha.

translation.en: Even if we get knocked down,
we get back up and we keep going.
We're playing for something extraordinary in the end.
translation.es: Jugamos por algo extraordinario al final.

translation.en: Qualifying for the World Cup, this has never happened for Gabon,
translation.es: Gabón nunca ha clasificadopara la Copa del Mundo.

translation.en: and, of course, my father.
translation.es: Y, por supuesto, tampoco mi padre.

translation.en: Yeah, it pisses me off that we didn't get a result.
translation.es: Sí, me molesta que no ganáramos.

translation.en: The night before, we were all on the same page.
translation.es: La noche anterior,todos estábamos en la misma página.

translation.en: [Pierre-François] We got frustrated. We got frustrated.
We were all over the place, but ultimately, it's up to us.
It was our fault.
We should be difficult to get past.
We've got to be honest. We didn't do that well enough.
translation.es: Debemos ser sinceros. No estuvimos bien.

translation.en: Look, we've got a match coming up. We just need to put in the practice.
translation.es: Mira, tenemos otro partido.Solo tenemos que practicar.

translation.en: [Tonda] Aubameyang, obviously, is the superstar.
He is the bearer of the Gabonese flag.
translation.es: Es el portador de la bandera de Gabón.

translation.en: If he manages to motivate his young teammates,
translation.es: Si logra motivar a sus jóvenes compañeros,

translation.en: if he can give them enough motivation to qualify,
I think it will be the best gift he will give to his country.
translation.es: creo que será el mejor regaloque le dará a su país.

translation.en: [announcer in English] The best player of the year,
Luka Modrić.
[Modrić in Croatian] All those awards I've received, it's just phenomenal.
translation.es: Todos esos premios que he recibido…Es fenomenal.

translation.en: [man] For the last ten years, Ronaldo and Messi shared the Ballon d'Or.
translation.es: En los últimos diez años, Ronaldo y Messicompartieron el Balón de Oro.

translation.en: [man] It's you!
[Modrić in Croatian] There's a sadness there, at least for me.
translation.es: Pero hay cierta tristeza ahí,al menos para mí.

translation.en: [Modrić in Croatian] I think about that final every day.
translation.es: Pienso en esa final todos los días.

translation.en: [Modrić in Croatian] It still has a hold on me.
translation.es: Aún la tengo en la cabeza.

translation.en: [in English] ♪ La-la-la-la-la-la, la-la ♪
♪ I've had my share of fame ♪
translation.es: Croacia llegó a la Finaldel Mundial FIFA 2018. El capitán Luka Modricfue el mejor jugador del torneo.

translation.en: ♪ You know my name ♪
translation.es: El capitán Luka Modricfue el mejor jugador del torneo.

translation.en: [in Croatian] Let me see how you receive it.
Bravo!
Let's do keepie uppies, the three of us.
Show me some of your tricks.
You're pretty good at this.
The best things never come easy.
translation.es: Las mejores cosas nunca son fáciles.

translation.en: Throughout my life and career,
translation.es: En mi vida y mi carrera,

translation.en: nothing has come easy to me.
First.
[man] Luka.
[Modrić] I don't like to talk about it…
translation.es: No me gusta hablar de eso…

translation.en: …the thing that has marked me for life.
translation.es: lo que me marcó de por vida.

translation.en: I was small, very small.
I remember some things.
I still remember my grandfather very well.
translation.es: Aún recuerdo muy bien a mi abuelo.

translation.en: He was a kind of protector for me.
translation.es: Era una especie de protector para mí.

translation.en: If I'd been naughty with my mom and dad, he would be there to defend me.
translation.es: Si me portaba mal con mamá y papá,él me defendía.

translation.en: He took me everywhere with him.
translation.es: Me llevaba con él a todas partes.

translation.en: There were a lot of animals, and he was with them around the clock.
translation.es: Había muchos animales,y él estaba con ellos todo el día.

translation.en: So when he would take them to graze, he would take me too.
translation.es: Si los llevaba a pastar,también me llevaba.

translation.en: I didn't go to kindergarten.
translation.es: No fui al jardín de infantes.

translation.en: I was up at my grandparents' house.
translation.es: Estaba en casa de mis abuelos.

translation.en: That's where I lived.
I have really lovely memories.
A carefree childhood until…
To be honest, I don't even like to think about this.
translation.es: La verdad, ni siquierame gusta pensar en eso.

translation.en: I was very young.
That's what stayed with me the most from my childhood.
translation.es: Eso es lo que más me quedó de mi infancia.

translation.en: Although I don't like… I don't like to talk about it.
translation.es: Aunque no me gusta…No me gusta hablar de eso.

translation.en: We had to escape from our home
translation.es: Tuvimos que escapar de nuestro hogar

translation.en: and go take refuge in hotels.
[Oštrić] We spent six years here.
Luka lived on the third floor, and I lived on the first floor.
translation.es: Luka vivía en el tercer piso,y yo, en el primero.

translation.en: [Modrić] It wasn't easy to live at that time.
translation.es: No era fácil en esa época.

translation.en: You hear those sirens, those bombs dropping, the missiles.
translation.es: Oyes las sirenas,las bombas cayendo, los misiles.

translation.en: [Oštrić] It's impossible not to feel fear when that's going on.
[Modrić] When I look at these childhood pictures, I'm always with a ball.
translation.es: Cuando miro estas fotos de la infancia,siempre estoy con un balón.

translation.en: You can immediately see
translation.es: Enseguida ves que el balón tendrá

translation.en: that the ball is going to play an important role in my life.
translation.es: Enseguida ves que el balón tendrá un papel importante en mi vida.

translation.en: Football was definitely a way out
translation.es: El fútbol era una forma de salir de eso

translation.en: of everything that was going on around us.
We'd use two stones as goalposts
translation.es: Usábamos dos piedrascomo postes de la portería

translation.en: at both ends of the parking lot.
[Modrić] And that's how it all started.
On the tarmac in front of the hotel…
translation.es: en el asfalto frente al hotel…

translation.en: where you got hit and pushed around.
I was amongst the smaller kids.
translation.es: Yo estaba entre los más pequeños.

translation.en: There was no complaining or crying.
You would move on and fight for yourself.
I was named after my grandfather.
translation.es: Llevo el nombre de mi abuelo.

translation.en: I'm sad that he didn't get to see… at least some of what I've achieved.
translation.es: Me entristece que no haya podido veral menos algo de lo que he logrado.

translation.en: But certainly, he's up there looking down on me, cheering me on.
translation.es: Pero sin duda está ahí arriba,mirándome, alentándome.

translation.en: And I'm sure he's proud of me.
[Blake in English] We wanna go to the World Cup. We haven't been there since '98.
translation.es: Queremos ir al Mundial.No hemos ido desde el 98.

translation.en: [commentator] Victory in Jamaica.
Jamaica has advanced to France '98.
[Blake in English] I can't even start to imagine,
translation.es: No puedo ni empezar a imaginar

translation.en: how would it feel for the nation, for the players…
[all in Jamaican Patois] We will do!
[Blake in English] …and for me as a captain to be going to the World Cup.
translation.es: y yo, como capitán,si vamos a la Copa del Mundo.

translation.en: What a moment that would be.
What a moment.
[man] When we qualified in 1998,
it was the biggest thing to happen in Jamaica since independence.
translation.es: fue lo más importante para Jamaicadesde la independencia.

translation.en: They declared a national holiday.
[woman] Results have to improve if we're going to qualify this time.
translation.es: Los resultados deben mejorarsi queremos clasificar esta vez.

translation.en: One game, one defeat, and the Reggae Boyz are bottom of the group.
translation.es: Un partido, una derrota, y los Reggae Boyzson los últimos del grupo.

translation.en: [in Jamaican Patois] '98-- World Cup '98, I was eight.
translation.es: Copa Mundial de 1998, tenía ocho años.

translation.en: You were eight? I wasn't even seven then.
-You were six. -Let's work it out.
-I'm 1990. When were you born? '92? -'94.
You are '94?
In 1998, you were four. You're a baby.
translation.es: En 1998 tenías cuatro años. Eras un bebé.

translation.en: You were really young, so you probably can't remember that.
translation.es: Eras muy pequeño,probablemente no lo recuerdes.

translation.en: You're DeAndre's age.
I was eight, and I can't even remember much.
translation.es: Tenía ocho años y no recuerdo mucho.

translation.en: Jamaica used to have one of the best, uh, World Cup songs.
translation.es: Jamaica teníauna de las mejores canciones del Mundial.

translation.en: -♪ Whoa, whoa, whoa ♪ -Yes.
The song's really hard, ya know?
♪ Rise up ♪
-[laughs] -I…
♪ Stand and take your place ♪
Yes. Yes.
[in English] Winning bringing healing to a nation because you know what it does?
translation.es: Ganar sana a una nación. ¿Sabes qué hace? Une a la gente.

translation.en: It brings the people together.
translation.es: ¿Sabes qué hace? Une a la gente.

translation.en: It unifies them, even if it's for one moment.
translation.es: Los unifica, aunque sea por un momento.

translation.en: It's like, when they win, we all win.
And when they lose, we all lose.
♪ Your journey has just begun ♪
-♪ Rise up ♪ -♪ Rise up ♪ -♪ Stand like the brave ♪ -♪ Oh yeah ♪
[Blake] We have a great group,
but I don't think the group understands yet
translation.es: pero no creo que el grupo entienda aún

translation.en: what it's gonna take to get to a World Cup.
translation.es: lo que se necesitapara llegar a un Mundial.

translation.en: It's something that I've detected. As a leader, I have to fix.
translation.es: Es algo que he detectadocomo líder, que debo arreglar.

translation.en: If we feel like because we have talent we won't have to work,
translation.es: Si sentimos que porque tenemos talento,no tendremos que trabajar,

translation.en: we're gonna have a problem.
We have pride for our country.
We have pride for our athletes
who go out there and actually do their best.
translation.es: que dan lo mejor de sí mismos.

translation.en: And we know most of them don't come back to no big accolades.
translation.es: Y sabemos que la mayoríano recibe grandes elogios.

translation.en: [Blake] It's one of the most talented groups we've ever had.
translation.es: Es uno de los grupos más talentosos.

translation.en: But if you don't fit the system
or you're not in with what we're about, then I don't think we need you.
translation.es: de qué se trata, entoncesno creo que te necesitemos.

translation.en: I would describe this current team as, um,
a mixture of English and Jamaican-born players.
translation.es: como una mezcla de jugadoresingleses y jamaiquinos.

translation.en: We have 23 guys coming in.
Twenty-three different backgrounds and 23 different egos.
It's hard.
[in Jamaican Patois] This way.
When we have the next one,
if you can, and there's nothing on the left,
translation.es: si puedes y no hay nada a la izquierda,

translation.en: you can pull back and you can press out again.
translation.es: puedes ir atrás y volver a presionar.

translation.en: [Blake in English] I wanna win. And, you know,
if I sense that the unity is not there, you know,
translation.es: si siento que la unidad no está ahí,

translation.en: I tend to get really worried.
[manager] That's it. Let us pray.
As we carry the hopes and dreams of our people,
translation.es: Llevamos los sueños de nuestra gente.

translation.en: let us understand that our service is first and foremost to our people.
translation.es: Que entendamos que nuestro servicioes ante todo para nuestro pueblo.

translation.en: [Blake] You're not gonna be able to beat a good team
translation.es: No podrán vencer a un buen equipo

translation.en: if you're not together.
Where we are weak, let us be strong.
That we will overcome
the many rivers we have to cross.
translation.es: los ríos que tenemos que cruzar.

translation.en: [man 1 in French] Gabon against Egypt, an important match.
[man 2] Aubameyang in Franceville against Salah. I would never have imagined that.
translation.es: Aubameyang en Franceville contra Salah,nunca lo hubiera imaginado.

translation.en: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.
[man 2] The cream of African football.
[Aubameyang] Mohamed Salah… He's a very nice person.
translation.es: Mohammed Salah… es una gran persona.

translation.en: We have a very good relationship,
but it's over.
[man 3] We hope national icon Aubameyang can lead us to victory.
translation.es: Esperamos que Aubameyangnos lleve a la victoria.

translation.en: [player] Come, look!
[Pierre-François] Football,
it is a religion for the Gabonese.
translation.es: es una religión para los gaboneses.

translation.en: [player] Yes, that's it!
Football connects ethnicities and communities
translation.es: El fútbol conecta etnias y comunidades,

translation.en: because it transcends.
[player] There!
[Tonda] It makes people forget a lot.
translation.es: Hace que la gente olvide cosas.

translation.en: If you have problems, you forget them
because the national team is playing.
[reporter 1] Everyone's predicting a win for the Panthers.
translation.es: Predicen una victoria para las Panteras.

translation.en: Are we being too optimistic?
[reporter 2] It's patriotism that is overshadowing realism ahead of this match.
translation.es: El patriotismo eclipsa al realismoantes de este partido.

translation.en: This moment of fusion in the body of the nation
translation.es: Este momento de fusiónen el cuerpo de la nación

translation.en: takes place through the name Aubameyang
translation.es: ocurre a través del nombre Aubameyang,

translation.en: because he is the embodiment of the nation.
translation.es: porque es la encarnación de la nación.

translation.en: [Aubameyang] The people of Gabon are very welcoming.
translation.es: La gente de Gabón es muy acogedora.

translation.en: There is a solidarity.
I want to show them that I will do anything for the team.
translation.es: Quiero mostrarlesque haré lo que sea por el equipo.

translation.en: That they can count on me.
I'm the captain of Gabon.
Representing Africa…
That's why I'm here.
[reporter 1 in English] Greetings, football family.
Happy World Cup qualifiers.
We have got big problems with the Jamaican national team right now.
translation.es: Tenemos grandes problemascon la selección jamaicana.

translation.en: [reporter 2] We've gambled on some new players
who have only just qualified to play for Jamaica.
translation.es: que acaban empezar a jugar con Jamaica.

translation.en: [reporter 1] Throwing players together doesn't really work.
You have to feel for Andre Blake,
captain of a side who have barely trained together.
translation.es: capitán de un equipoque apenas ha entrenado.

translation.en: [Blake] You guys ready to sing later?
[player] I already sang.
[Blake] When new players come in, they have to sing a song.
translation.es: Cuando llegan jugadores,deben cantar una canción.

translation.en: That's kind of a way to come together collectively
and to just have some fun.
Tonight, big stage show.
[Marley] Music is so important to sports, you know?
translation.es: La música es importante en el deporte.

translation.en: It's like it kinda… it kinda goes hand in hand.
[player 1] Roofe's ready.
[Roofe] Roofe's not ready, fam.
Roofe says he's opening the show.
translation.es: Roofe dice que abrirá el show.

translation.en: [Blake] For me, unity is one of the most important things.
translation.es: La unidad es algo muy importante.

translation.en: Sometimes you can tell when that's not there.
translation.es: A veces se nota cuando no hay.

translation.en: Like I said, don't expect anything good.
translation.es: Como dije, no esperes nada bueno.

translation.en: Hey, no, it doesn't need to be good, bro.
translation.es: DELANTERO DE JAMAICA No tiene que ser bueno.

translation.en: They heard about you, eh? [laughs]
translation.es: - No cantaré con esas cámaras.- Se enteraron sobre ti.

translation.en: They heard about your big performance tonight.
translation.es: Se enteraron de tu gran actuación.

translation.en: [Blake] All right! All right!
Showtime!
-[singing] -[players drumming, exclaiming]
Oh, next!
All the way from England,
Lowe is here to take it.
-[player 1] One word. -[player 2] It's all we're asking for.
[chanting] One word! Word! Word! Word!
♪ Got somebody ♪
Players only!
Remove yourself!
[Blake] The biggest challenge right now going into the World Cup qualifiers
translation.es: El mayor desafío ahorapara las eliminatorias del Mundial

translation.en: is to get this group to play as a team.
translation.es: es hacer que este grupojuegue como un equipo.

translation.en: [Aubameyang in French] When it's game day, I always have goosebumps.
translation.es: El día del partidose me pone la piel de gallina.

translation.en: I'm ready to give everything to make the team succeed.
translation.es: Voy a darlo todopara que el equipo triunfe.

translation.en: [Blake in English] I get nervous sometimes.
The bigger the game, the bigger the moment.
translation.es: Cuanto más grande el partido,más nervios.

translation.en: [commentator in Croatian] We are live from the Luzhniki Stadium,
translation.es: Estamos en vivo desde el estadio Luzhniki,

translation.en: the mythical ground of Croatian football.
translation.es: el campo mítico del fútbol croata.

translation.en: This is where we played the legendary final against the French.
translation.es: Aquí jugamos la legendaria finalcontra los franceses.

translation.en: Memories that will live on forever.
The absence of captain Luka Modrić
translation.es: La ausencia del capitán Luka Modric

translation.en: has of course worried everyone in the national team.
translation.es: ha preocupado a todosen el equipo nacional.

translation.en: [Modrić] Unfortunately, because of an injury, I couldn't be with the national team.
translation.es: Por una lesión,no pude estar con el equipo nacional.

translation.en: [commentator] It's clear how much of a blow his absence is for Croatia.
translation.es: Está claro que su ausenciaes un golpe para Croacia.

translation.en: But as Coach Dalić said ahead of the match,
Croatia will soon have to face a future without Luka.
translation.es: Croacia tendrá que enfrentarun futuro sin Luka.

translation.en: [Modrić] I'm aware that I'm of a certain age,
translation.es: Soy consciente de que tengo cierta edad

translation.en: and that this is my last competition with the Croatian national team.
translation.es: y que esta es mi última competenciacon la selección croata.

translation.en: Come here.
[in English] Who's playing, Sofi?
[in Croatian] Who's playing?
Who's playing?
Who's playing?
Is it Croatia? Huh?
-Croatia. -Croatia.
What do you think the score will be?
-Two-one. -Two-one.
translation.es: - Dos a uno.- Dos a uno.

translation.en: -[Sofia in English] Daddy! -[in Croatian] Is it a regular game?
What do you mean?
[in English] Friendly. Friendly. -Huh? -Friendly.
[in Croatian] No, these are the World Cup qualifiers.
translation.es: No, son las eliminatorias para el Mundial.

translation.en: -Yes. For Qatar. -Then we have to win.
translation.es: - Sí. Para Catar.- Entonces tenemos que ganar.

translation.en: Of course, if it were a friendly…
[in English] Sofi, we have to win.
[in Croatian] Yes, this is for the World Cup.
Who is the captain when you don't play?
translation.es: ¿Quién es el capitán si no juegas?

translation.en: -[boy] Perišić. -Perišić.
[girl] Who is the captain when Perišić or you aren't playing?
translation.es: ¿Quién es el capitáncuando Perisic y tú no juegan?

translation.en: [Modrić] Lovren or Vida.
Is Vida playing?
No, he has yellow cards, so he can't.
translation.es: No, tiene tarjetas amarillas, no puede.

translation.en: -Two? -Yes, two.
Was he angry?
[exhales] Yes, very.
-[in English] Give me the ball. -[Sofia] It's my ball.
translation.es: - Dame el balón, por favor.- No, es mío.

translation.en: No, it's my ball.
-[Sofia] No, it's mine. -It's my ball.
It's my ball, yes.
-Ema's ball. -My ball.
-[Sofia] Hey, share. -Share. Okay.
You didn't share with me.
Yes, she always shares.
[Modrić in Croatian] It's hard for me when I'm not with the national team.
translation.es: Es duro para mí no jugar con la selección.

translation.en: [in French] Are we ready?
[reporter] Only five African teams will qualify for Qatar 2022.
translation.es: Solo cinco equipos africanosclasificarán para Catar 2022.

translation.en: Egypt are the big favorites here in Franceville.
translation.es: Egipto es el favorito aquí en Franceville.

translation.en: Can Aubameyang's men cause an upset tonight
and reignite their campaign against this talented Egypt side
translation.es: reavivar su campañacontra el talentoso equipo egipcio

translation.en: led by the incomparable Mohamed Salah?
translation.es: liderado por el gran Mohammed Salah?

translation.en: [in English] Rock, paper, scissors, shoot!
[reporter 1 in Jamaican Patois] If Jamaica wins today,
we are back into the thick of things. Right?
[reporter 2] We just have to make sure that we get the ball to whoever's up top
translation.es: Solo debemos llevar la pelotaa quien esté adelante

translation.en: to put into the back of the net.
Andre Blake doing his best, letting none go in.
translation.es: Andre Blake se esfuerzapara que no les hagan goles.

translation.en: [reporter 1 in English] Jamaica will win this game. I feel it.
translation.es: Jamaica ganará este partido. Lo sé.

translation.en: [Blake] Wearing the captain's band,
you can't show your teammates certain things.
translation.es: no puedes demostrar ciertas cosasa tus compañeros.

translation.en: They're looking to you,
so you can't show fear,
you can't show nerves.
[in Croatian] When you watch the game, are you nervous or not?
translation.es: Cuando miras el partido,¿estás nervioso o no?

translation.en: Are you nervous or not?
Do you think we'll win?
Sometimes.
[Modrić] When you're watching on TV, it's really nerve-racking.
translation.es: Cuando lo miras por TV, es muy estresante.

translation.en: You get much more nervous than when you play.
translation.es: Te pones mucho más nerviosoque cuando juegas.

translation.en: [commentator] Now the real fight starts.
translation.es: Ahora comienza la lucha. CROACIA: 6 PUNTOSRUSIA: 6

translation.en: Tonight against Russia, it couldn't be harder.
translation.es: Hoy, contra Rusia, es muy difícil.

translation.en: [in French] Every ball, every minute, we give everything, boys. Everything.
translation.es: Cada balón, cada minuto,lo damos todo, chicos.

translation.en: Nobody gives up.
[Blake in English] Out in eight, gents. Get yourself ready.
[man in French] Strong, guys.
[Aubameyang] Together!
Right until the end. Come on!
[Blake in Jamaican Patois] Now! Let's go!
[in French] It's a World Cup qualifier. Don't forget that. Keep it in mind.
translation.es: Es un clasificatorio para el Mundial.No lo olviden.

translation.en: Let's give everything. We can do it. Come on!
[all chanting in Jamaican Patois] We will do! We will do! Jamaica!
[in French] Come on, boys!
[Blake in English] As a group, how hard are we willing to work?
translation.es: Como grupo,¿cuánto estamos dispuestos a trabajar?

translation.en: How much are we willing to suffer?
You're talking about the World Cup.
translation.es: Hablas de la Copa del Mundo.

translation.en: [commentator in French] Welcome to Franceville for the match
translation.es: Bienvenidos a Franceville para el partido

translation.en: between the Panthers and the Pharaohs.
translation.es: entre las Panteras y los Faraones.

translation.en: Gabon versus Egypt.
[Aubameyang] Everyone always expects the most from you.
translation.es: Todos esperan lo mejor de ti.

translation.en: When we're in the tunnel,
it's a very special moment.
You see the pitch, and you can't wait to get out there.
translation.es: Ves la cancha y ya quieres salir.

translation.en: [commentator] Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang, the captain.
The Panthers will rely on him a lot today.
translation.es: Las Panteras confiarán mucho en él hoy.

translation.en: [Sofia in English] One, two! One, two, three!
[commentator in Croatian] Russia, our opponents tonight, are the toughest team in the group.
translation.es: Rusia, nuestro rival de esta noche,es el equipo más duro del grupo.

translation.en: [commentator in French] Here we go. The kick-off whistle.
[Aubameyang] I think we have a lot of potential.
I've always said it.
I think it's the best generation I've ever known.
translation.es: Creo que es la mejor generación de todas.

translation.en: [commentator in English] Panama will get things underway.
translation.es: CLASIFICATORIO, NORTE Y CENTROAMÉRICA Empieza Panamá, de izquierda a derecha.

translation.en: We're kicking from left to right.
translation.es: Empieza Panamá, de izquierda a derecha.

translation.en: [commentator in Croatian] Without Modrić today,
Perišić accepts the task of captaincy.
translation.es: Perisic acepta la tarea de capitanía.

translation.en: Miranchuk. He's a very dangerous player.
translation.es: Miranchuk. Es un jugador muy peligroso.

translation.en: He shoots. It's gone over the bar.
Close him down.
[commentator in English] Jamaica trying to build from their half.
translation.es: Jamaica intenta construir desde su mitad.

translation.en: We're getting pushed back so deep!
[commentator] Jamaica giving away possession.
Panama on the attack, puts the play on the left-hand side
translation.es: Panamá al ataque, juega por la izquierda

translation.en: right down to Rodriguez.
A shot! And right to goalkeeper Blake, diving to his right.
translation.es: ¡Patea! Y derecho al portero Blake,que se lanza a la derecha.

translation.en: [Blake] We couldn't put five passes together.
translation.es: No pudimos hacer cinco pases seguidos.

translation.en: It was just chaotic.
[commentator] Panama on the attack. What a strike!
[Blake] There was no cohesiveness. There was no chemistry.
translation.es: No había cohesión, no había química.

translation.en: [commentator in Croatian] A chance for Croatia.
Perišić. It wasn't a great shot. It surprised him.
translation.es: Perisic. No fue muy buena. Lo sorprendió.

translation.en: [commentator in French] Mohamed Salah has magnificent control.
translation.es: Salah controla el balón como nadie.

translation.en: A fantastic pass there.
Now, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
A goal. No! The save from El Shenawy.
I was sure that was a goal.
[commentator in English] Forward again. Here comes Panama. Floats the ball inside the penalty area.
translation.es: Aquí viene Panamá otra vez.El balón dentro del área de penal.

translation.en: Header! Beautiful header!
[Blake] After the second goal…
[commentator] Oh my word!
[Blake] …"Am I dreaming? Is this happening for real?"
"Will somebody wake me up?"
[commentator] The visitors, they're leading by two goals to nil.
translation.es: Los visitantesvan ganando por dos goles a cero.

translation.en: [commentator in French] Nil-nil between Gabon and Egypt.
translation.es: Cero a cero entre Gabón y Egipto.

translation.en: [commentator in Croatian] Croatia have had more possession but have done nothing with it.
translation.es: Croacia ha tenido más posesión,pero no ha hecho nada con eso.

translation.en: [commentator in English] Coach Tappa Whitmore of the Jamaica team has to make some changes
translation.es: El entrenador de Jamaica, Tappa Whitmore,tiene que hacer cambios,

translation.en: because Panama, they're all over the Jamaicans at the present time.
translation.es: porque en Panamá están todostras los jamaiquinos.

translation.en: [player 1] To me, I think we should start by pressing them.
translation.es: Creo que debemos empezar a presionarlos.

translation.en: We're at home. We're down 2-0. We need to chase the game.
translation.es: Perdemos 2 a 0 como locales.Hay que esforzarse.

translation.en: We need a structure of pressing them. We go, we get picked off.
[player 2] It's not structure.
Need to change formation. We're too open in midfield.
-We need someone in the midfield. -[coach] Stop talking.
translation.es: MEDIOCAMPISTA DE JAMAICA - Más mediocampo.- Deja de hablar.

translation.en: Before you talk about formation, before you talk about anything, right?
translation.es: Antes de hablar de formación o algo,

translation.en: They're outfighting us.
They're quicker to the ball.
They are quicker to the second balls, guys.
Right? We're pressing and just jogging up to the ball.
It's like a testimonial!
What is that all about? They're moving quicker than us.
translation.es: ¿Qué pasa? Se muevenmás rápido que nosotros.

translation.en: We are at home!
We are at home. You can do any formation you want.
translation.es: Pueden tener la formación que quieran.

translation.en: They run faster, quicker than you, guess what?
We get beat.
Come on. Come on.
[in French] We give it all until the end.
If you're tired, come off and the subs give everything too.
translation.es: Si se cansan, los suplentes lo darán todo.

translation.en: -We're in the game, boys. -[man] We're in the game.
We're in it.
[in English] They need to think this is a cauldron, and it's too hot.
translation.es: Deben pensar que es un calderoy que está muy caliente.

translation.en: Somebody take some leadership.
Somebody just take the game by the scruff of the neck and go.
translation.es: Que alguien tome el partido por el cuello.

translation.en: [in French] It's time to score, guys. We are hungry.
translation.es: Es hora de anotar. Tenemos hambre.

translation.en: Come on, guys.
-[whistle blows] -[tense music plays]
[commentator] There is nothing between these two teams despite the Panthers' dominance.
translation.es: No hay nada entre estos dos equiposa pesar del dominio de las Panteras.

translation.en: And here we have Boupendza.
One-on-one with Mohamed El Shenawy.
translation.es: Uno a uno con Mohammed El Shenawy.

translation.en: [Aubameyang] We had a great game, a great game,
and we are rewarded.
[commentator] What's going on? What's going on?
Oh, it's a red card.
[Aubameyang] Of course, that gives us that extra energy, and it gives you hope.
translation.es: Eso nos da esa energía extra,y te da esperanza.

translation.en: So it was the moment to take points off them.
translation.es: Era el momento de quitarles puntos.

translation.en: [in Jamaican Patois] Move up! Move up! Move up!
[in English] At 2-0, are we still in the game? At least to get a point.
translation.es: ¿Seguimos jugando con un 2 a 0?Al menos para obtener un punto.

translation.en: I do feel, um, somewhat distant as the goalkeeper.
translation.es: Me siento algo distante como portero.

translation.en: And it can be very frustrating, you know? Especially whenever I get scored on.
translation.es: Y puede ser muy frustrante.Especialmente cuando anotan.

translation.en: [commentator] Waterman, he dances,
and beats the goalkeeper, Blake, to his left.
translation.es: Y le gana al portero, Blake,a su izquierda.

translation.en: Oh my word.
That's cherry on the top, icing on the cake.
[Blake] That was like the dagger. That's it.
translation.es: Eso fue como una daga. Se terminó.

translation.en: [commentator in Croatian] Ivanušec enters the box. Ivanušec shoots.
translation.es: Ivanusec entra al área. Ivanusec patea.

translation.en: Man, we're five times better than them. Come on.
translation.es: Somos cinco vecesmejores que ellos. Vamos.

translation.en: [commentator in French] It's Obiang. One-two.
He's in the penalty area.
translation.es: Está en el área de penal.

translation.en: They shoot and they score!
The Panthers claw the Egyptian Pharaohs.
translation.es: Las Panteras atacana los Faraones egipcios.

translation.en: -One-zero. -[fans cheering, applauding]
translation.es: Uno a cero. GABÓN 1 - EGIPTO 073 MINUTOS

translation.en: [in Croatian] Clear it away.
Clear it!
What are you doing?
[commentator] Kovačić. Kovačić! What an opportunity, but it's wide.
[commentator] If that had gone in, Croatia would be celebrating at the Luzhniki Stadium.
translation.es: Si hubiera entrado, Croacia celebraríaen el estadio Luzhniki.

translation.en: [commentator in English] And that signals the end of the matchup.
translation.es: Y eso marca el final del partido.

translation.en: Captain Blake looks dejected.
[Blake] It could have easily been 6-0.
We didn't fight hard enough. We didn't show enough character.
translation.es: No peleamos lo suficiente.No mostramos suficiente carácter. JAMAICA 0 - PANAMÁ 3

translation.en: [in Croatian] Well, a point is not bad if we beat Slovakia and Slovenia.
translation.es: Bueno, un punto no está malsi ganamos a Eslovaquia y Eslovenia.

translation.en: [Aubameyang in French] I don't think I've ever seen Gabon play so well.
translation.es: Nunca vi jugar tan bien a Gabón.

translation.en: We started to believe.
[commentator] We're in the last minutes of this match.
translation.es: Son los últimos minutos del partido.

translation.en: The final push.
Aubameyang is full of fighting spirit.
[Aubameyang] It was a strange game.
[commentator] A victory here would give them a chance in the group after the defeat to Libya.
translation.es: Una victoria les daría una chanceen el grupo, tras la derrota ante Libia.

translation.en: [Aubameyang] At that moment, we were on the right path.
But…
you have to be focused.
Every detail counts until the last second.
translation.es: Cada detalle cuentahasta el último segundo.

translation.en: [commentator] Attention. Watch out.
